phys_exam: Thyroid and pelvic US scan were normal
Carpal x-ray revealed a bone age 4 years older than chronological age
Spine x-ray revealed left-convex lumbar rotoscoliosis with moderate right-convex compensatory curvature
Valgus knees and flat feet noted
Mild dysmorphic features: high frontal hairline, slight asymmetric face, deeply set eyes, slight prognathism, small ears, bifid uvula, peg-shaped incisors
Long and thin fingers, prominent phalanx epiphyses, camptodactyly of fingers and toes, first and second fingers clinodactyly on the left hand, second and third fingers clinodactyly on the right hand
Clinodactyly and proximal placement of the fifth toes bilaterally
Mild joint hyperextensibility with a Beighton score of 5/9
Skin examination revealed no striae distensae, bruising, atrophic scars, or pigmentation disorders

changes_over_time.kidney: Dysplastic multicystic right kidney identified during pregnancy atrophied over time
changes_over_time.hearing_loss: Bilateral pantonal sensorineural hearing loss diagnosed at age 10
changes_over_time.height: Height greater than 97th centile since the first months of life
